sub_title: Event moderator | Host | Dagvoorzitter | Experienced presenter with a great passion for innovation | Family constellation facilitator | Certified Mediator
summary:
Psychologist with 15+ years of experience in the (deep)tech and startup/scale-up scene in the Netherlands and the United States. In 2023, I want to become the best presenter I can be, as well as build my mediation practice. 

Please feel absolutely welcome to reach out to me if you need a host for your event, or would like help resolving a conflict.

Longer summary:
After graduating at the end of 2011, I lived in the US for 3 years and led the expansion of Dutch company Dopper from San Francisco. When returning to the Netherlands at the end of 2015,  I worked in and around the Dutch startup scene in all kinds of capacities as an entrepreneurial project leader, founder or managing director. 

I led many projects from A to Z, organised small intimate gathering as well as large international events with hundreds of people. Initiated campaigns and initiatives to motivate groups of people to change their behaviors, like the Buy Nothing New-Month and 'Tevredenlander'. I would say I'm entrepreneurial in the sense that I think like an entrepreneur, am used to going the extra mile, and then some, and know I have the end-responsibility for results. This makes others able to relax:)

Right now, my focus lies on 3 things:
→ Moderating and hosting events
→ Mediation
→ Organizational- and family constellations.

So excited about hosting and moderating events on all kinds of topics, but often related to tech, deeptech, startups, investing, international relations, geopolitics. Graduated as a psychologist and a certified mediator, where I help client resolve conflicts. Every two months, I organize an afternoon of constellations in Amsterdam.

If you'd like to reach me, you can do so via 📧 irenerompa@gmail.com or 
📞 +316 28 25 28 79. Speak soon!

treasury_media.title: Opening up to kindness | Irene Rompa | TEDxAmsterdam
treasury_media.description: All of us want to be kind, but how good are we receiving kindness? Irene recounts a touching series of episodes where she allowed others to be kind and found them more than ready to jump at the opportunity

profile_positions.description:
The projects I support(ed) in various capacities as an independent contractor:

⇛ International expansion market-research @ Getaround [3 months]:
Researched the international opportunities for LEV (getlev.nl) for US based company Getaround. LEV launched in the fall of 2019. Getaround was founded ten years ago and has since grown into a leading peer-to-peer car sharing platform in America.

⇛ Firmhouse Venture Lab @ Firmhouse [6 months]:
Co-organised, designed and mentored this program specifically aimed at individual entrepreneurs looking for their co-founder. A cohort of 12 individuals got selected during a selection weekend, received training, mentorship and help in finding a co-founder for the duration of 3.5 months. Two teams that were established received an investment at the end of the program. NPS score of entire program: 45

⇛ Data Science Initiative @ Municipality of The Hague [6 months]:
This initiative was set up to facilitate organisations that work in the field of peace, justice and security in getting more access to innovative technologies like artificial intelligence. My specific role during its foundation phase was the realisation of its launch-event, the 'Hackathon for Good'. NATO, the Red Cross, Asser Institute, World Vision and the International Criminal Court put forth data and AI challenges; our team activated a community of 120 tech talents to take a stab at the challenges and connect with the organisations in The Hague. NPS score of this event: 84

⇛ Scale-Up Café @ EMERCE [4 months]:
End-responsible for this side-event of Emerce's eDay on 11 October 2018, at which twenty scale-ups met with investors, potential clients, partners and seasoned entrepreneurs. Average grade given by participants: 8.6

Quantum Delta NL is the public private partnership of global tech companies, public agencies and all the major quantum research hubs in the Netherlands. 

Our mission is to further strengthen the flourishing Dutch quantum ecosystem to become the most relevant for Europe.
profile_positions.title: Head Of Communications

profile_positions.description:
Lieve zorgdragers van Nederland,
Samen staan we sterk. Maar zonder jullie zijn we nergens.
Heel Nederland draagt momenteel de consequenties van de COVID-19 pandemie. Maar jullie dragen ook zorg voor de oplossing ervan. En dat is geen geringe last.
Wij, jullie medelanders, hebben veel bewondering voor de manier waarop jullie je dag na dag en nacht na nacht inzetten. Daarom speciaal voor jullie: een digitaal hart onder de riem.      
En op dinsdag, om 20:00, een landelijk applaus.
Veel sterkte. En heel veel dank!
profile_positions.title: Initiatiefnemer

profile_positions.description:
DEEL is a cooperative that helps residents set up their own local co-ops with neighbours for the purpose of sharing vehicles. 

Our mission is to create more public space; sharing vehicles is a way to get there. 

25 neighbours might now own 25 cars, which are not used fulltime. If these 25 neighbours form a co-op and own 5 cars together, they each pay a lot less money but have access to newer vehicles and, if they choose to, a variety of vehicles. The unused 20 cars would leave their street instantly. Using a commercial carsharing service for commuting to work is unaffordable at this point; commuting to work when you're part of a co-op costs much less than owning your own car.

A cooperative, a 'co-op, is a legal entity that is owned and operated by and for the benefit of its members. The local co-op can buy or lease its own vehicles, based on the wishes and usage of its members. Members decide themselves how many and what type of vehicles to buy or lease. DEEL does not own any vehicles and in no way makes money by the usage of local co-op members, we merely facilitate them in their process. 

Among other things, our work consists of
▹ helping residents decipher & facilitate the process of creating a local coop
▹ offering all necessary documentation needed to start
▹ analysing their current behaviour which helps them choose their number and type of vehicles
▹ offering a cost-calculation model with which to share costs between members 
▹ negotiating on their behalf with municipalities and arrange for fixed parking spots, charging stations ánd the opportunity to transform their street or neighbourhood if the coop shows they need less parking spots (which is almost always the case)

Residents in The Hague that choose to form a local co-op are guaranteed of fixed parking spots for their vehicles as well as the opportunity to transform their street.

Please see our website for more information and contact me directly via irene@wijzijndeel.nl

profile_positions.title: Board Member

profile_positions.description:
Let it Grow:
- communicates about the positive effects of flowers and plants in an urban environment 
- helps startups that work with flowers and plants in new ways, accelerate their businesses
 
Plants and flowers can drastically improve the quality of our urban lives by making cities happier and healthier. We inspire city dwellers to rethink healthy living in the context of plants and flowers, and bring together ideas that shape the future of our cities. Let it Grow wants to accelerate the movement of urban green living.  
 
I lead Let it Grow Entrepreneurs, in which we facilitate innovators in growing their businesses and/or projects by 
- running an annual five-month incubation programme which includes an investment, training and mentorship
- organising intensive bootcamps for international startups as well as entrepreneurs already active in the floriculture sector
- bringing together entrepreneurs and decision makers in this space, at several events like Unconferences
 
Let it Grow is an initiative of Royal FloraHolland.
profile_positions.title: Lead Let it Grow Entrepreneurs

profile_positions.description:
Tevredenlander is an initiative that encourages people to share what they're happy with in the Netherlands. It called for a more positive sound about the country during the elections in 2017. 

We ask people to reflect on what they're content with in our country and share this message on their social channels using the hashtag #tevredenlander. All messages are aggregated on our website www.tevredenlander.nl, which has become a collection of people's opinions about what is going well in the Netherlands. 

Many things need improvement and emphasising they do, is good. At the same time -luckily- many things are going really well - and they can be talked about ánd shared as well. In fact, it might be more important than ever to do so.
profile_positions.title: Initiator

profile_positions.description:
Buy Nothing New is a movement that started in Australia in 2010 and was set up in the Netherlands in 2012. The "Buy Nothing New Maand" is one month in which people pledge to discover what they already have & what the fun alternatives to buying new things are. 

Swop, give-away, re-use, repair, rent, create & buy second hand. Why? Because it is fun, makes you more creative, because it'll save you money (that you can then spend on a fun experience), because we keep using up finite resources to make new things even though there are already so many great things out there, and because buying a lot of new things automatically creates unnecessary waste. 
But even more so, because we seem to have lost a sense of the real value in our "stuff"- in other words, tend to keep buying 'things we don't need, with money we don't have, to impress people we don't like'.

We would love for this month to stimulate the creation of a more circular economy and make us re-assess the value of things so that we buy stuff that actually makes us very happy :) 
We organize the Buy Nothing New Challenge in October of each year, during which thousands of people participate. The month has received great media attention online, in local and national newspapers, on television and radio - see www.buynothingnew.nl (we're currently relaunching the website for 2021)
profile_positions.title: Initiator (Dutch edition)

profile_positions.description:
Imagine an entire country working together to organise the biggest startup festival on the planet. 

Between 24 and 28 May 2016, Startup Fest Europe will take place at 20+ locations throughout the Netherlands, during which vertical-specific events that highlight the diversity and strength of the various Dutch startup hubs, will be organised. 

Startup Fest Europe is a week long festival that takes place during the European presidency and aims to stimulate new thinking and new collaborations. The festival kicks off with an Opening Ceremony on May 24th during which Apple's Tim Cook, UBER's Travis Kalanick, Alphabet's Eric Schmidt and Airbnb's Nathan Blecharczyk will be key note speakers.
profile_positions.title: International Speaker Liaison

profile_positions.description:
DutchBasecamp is a non-profit that connects the startup ecosystems of Silicon Valley and The Netherlands, and strengthens the Dutch startup ecosystem in any way it can. Our goal is for The Netherlands to be thé startup hub in Europe.

In the first half of 2015, I led the team that built www.startupdelta.org, the "online portal" which represents the entire Dutch startup ecosystem.
